item.title: TOWIE's Tommy Mallet has BANNED girlfriend Georgia Kousoulou from plastic surgery after controversial nose job
item.description: Speaking to New! , the 25-year-old TOWIE star admitted he 'wouldn't let' the blonde, 26, have any more plastic surgery, as he loves her the way she is.
item.content:encoded:
She has faced a barrage of abuse on social media since unveiling the results of her nose job last year.

And Georgia Kousoulou's boyfriend Tommy Mallet has revealed he does not want her to go under the knife again, despite her new-found sense of confidence.

Speaking to New! magazine, the 25-year-old TOWIE star admitted he 'wouldn't let' the blonde, 26, have any more plastic surgery, as he loves her the way she is. 

Transformed: Georgia Kousoulou's boyfriend Tommy Mallett has revealed he does not want her to have any more surgery, after she faced abuse from trolls over her new nose

In a joint interview with the publication, Georgia confirmed she had no plans to have any more cosmetic procedures after her nose job - with Tommy swiftly interjecting that she was not allowed to anyway.

When asked if she would go under the knife again, the blonde said firmly: 'No. I've always hated my nose but I never told anyone because I didn't want anyone to look out for it.'

Clearly supportive of the decision, Tommy then added: 'I wouldn't let her anyway. Well, I wouldn't want her to.'

Back in the day: The blonde, 26, revealed she has no plans to have any more surgery - with Tommy, 25, admitting he 'wouldn't let her' anyway (pictured in August 2017)

While Georgia admitted the comments about her new nose from trolls have been 'shocking', she insisted she felt happier than ever with her appearance, which is still healing.

She added: 'It takes six months to a year, so I haven't even fully recovered yet. I feel so much more confident.'

Georgia revealed her new nose in November last year - having been desperate to change it since seeing her mother and aunties do the same. 

'I feel more confident': While the comments from trolls have been 'shocking', Georgia insisted she felt happier than ever with her new nose (R) which is still healing (pictured left in 2016) 

Here she is: Georgia revealed her new nose in November last year - having been desperate to change it since seeing her mother and aunties do the same (pictured in March 2018)  

After testing out filler, she underwent the surgery before Christmas and was left delighted with the results.

However, she later admitted she initially regretted the procedure, as she was compared to Michael Jackson by 'disgusting' trolls online.

Speaking of the devastating comments earlier this year, she said: 'I remember crying to my my mum, saying, "Oh my God! Have I done the right thing? Have I changed my face?"' 

'I was looking at myself thinking, "Do I look that bad?" I had to remind myself, no I wanted this done.' 

'I had to remind myself, I wanted this done': However, she later admitted she initially regretted the procedure, as she was compared to Michael Jackson by 'disgusting' trolls online

While she has vowed against surgery in the future, the TOWIE star has undergone a range of other procedures in the past.  

In 2015, she spoke about her boob job, and deemed her chest size, 'the only thing that [she] wasn't happy with.

'I didn't like the shape of them and wanted to fill them out, so I went from a B to an E cup,' she told OK! magazine. 'I did it for myself and I don't regret it. It's one of the best things I ever did.'

She simultaneously had work done on her lips, admitting: 'I wanted them bigger, so I had the outline done last year. I'd never do it again, though. I don't need to play around with them any more.' 

Support system: Tommy has been been dating Georgia for almost three years, and has been openly supportive of her decision (pictured in November 2016)
item.dc:abstract: She has faced a barrage of abuse on social media since unveiling the results of her nose job last year. And Georgia Kousoulou's boyfriend Tommy Mallett has revealed he does not want her to go under the knife again, despite her new-found sense of confidence. Speaking to New!, the 25-year-old TOWIE star admitted he 'wouldn't let' the blonde, 26, have any more plastic surgery, as he loves her the way she is.

item.title: EXCLUSIVE: 'I am very proud of my BRIT Award!' Steps star Claire Richards insists she will NEVER sell her gong... after former pop star Paul Cattermole tried to sell his for £66,000
item.description: Claire has revealed that she would never sell her award like former pop star Paul Cattermole, 40, did earlier this year - trading it for £66,100 on online auctioning site eBay.
item.content:encoded:
She won a BRIT Award for Best Live Act with Steps in 2000, the same year that S Club 7 won Best Newcomer.

But Claire Richards, 40, has revealed that she would never sell her award like former pop star Paul Cattermole, 40, who tried to earlier this year on online auctioning siteeBay.  

Talking about the prestigious prize, she told MailOnline: 'Mine is in my office in a bell jar so it’s protected, all polished and lovely so I will never be selling mine.'

'I am very proud of my BRIT award!': Claire Richards (front centre) admits she would never sell her prize like fellow winner Paul Cattermole did with his on eBay earlier this year

Claire was burtally honest about how she felt about his decision, and said: 'It’s his, he probably had to pay for it in the first place because I had to pay for mine, so I guess it’s up to him what he does with it.  

'I am very proud of my BRIT award and it’s something I’ve always wanted so it’s got pride of place in amongst all my discs and stuff in my office. 

'It’ll never be sold anywhere, it’s a shame but if that’s what he wants to do then it’s up to him really.'

Not following suit: Claire was brutally honest about her opinion of Paul: 'I am very proud of [mine] so it’ll never be sold, it’s a shame but if that’s what he wants to do then it’s up to him'

Old times:  The singer won a BRIT Award for Best Live Act with Steps in 2000, the same year that S Club 7 won Best Newcomer

Paul cited 'paying bills' as the reason for putting his award up for auction and originally listed it for £65,000, after a performance of The Rocky Horror Picture Show went wrong and forced him to quit the production.

The S Club 7 singer recently spoke to NME about the accident, and said: 'There was an un-choreographed bit of dancing and someone fell on me. I was out of the show for about two months. My back has gone - it hasn’t been right since.

'Things just haven’t gone well this year (in terms of finding work) with that injury.'

Happy days: Claire enjoyed tremendous success with her Steps bandmates (L-R: Lisa Scott-Lee, Faye Tozer, Ian Watkins, Lee Latchford-Evans and Claire Richards in 2000)

Mum-of-two Claire received an entirely different gong in October last year, when she was honoured with the Specs Appeal Award.

The singer has also now become the face of the Specsavers Spectacle Wearer of the Year Awards, which supports the anti-bullying children's charity Kidscape.

Reflecting on her new role, Claire spoke passionately about the charity who work to keep children safe from bullying by providing services and counselling.

She said: 'It's so important for kids to have someone to talk to, and not everybody has the luxury, or is brave enough to talk to those around them.

'To be able to rely on a charity like Kidscape is invaluable, especially in this day and age with all this cyber bullying, social media, and all that stuff.'

The Tragedy songstress even began to speak openly about her own problems, as she admitted to being 'bullied in school' but was quick to add: '[It was] not to any dangerous extreme and we didn’t have Twitter, Instagram, or that whole sense of one-upmanship.

Popular choice: The singer has also now become the face of the Specsavers Spectacle Wearer of the Year Awards, which supports the anti-bullying children's charity Kidscape 

'It’s all about who’s Instagram is the best, who takes the best photos, and who’s got the best social life, and [even] who has the newest designer handbag.' 

During the awards, Specsavers pledged £1 for every entry they received for the Spectacle Wearer Of The Year Award which thousands of people applied to.

Speaking about the good work this does for the charity, the chanteuse added: 'All the money that goes to helping these kids is so important, they are looking after our kids and protecting them from that nasty side of social media, and how cruel it can be.' 

Claire currently raises her children with her husband Reece Hill — who she married in 2008.

She was previously married to dancer Mark Webb in 2003 but they went their separate ways in 2005.

Propelled into stardom in 1997 as part of Steps, the 90s band courted attention once more when they announced the group would reunite for their 20th Anniversary last year.

Dedicated: Claire is passionate about the charity, who work to keep children safe from bullying by providing services and counselling

But while fans were very excited to hear that the group were getting back together, the members weren't sure at first.

She explained: 'We had a lot of conversations because we were quite worried about it. We were trying to figure out where does Steps fit in modern day music? Where does it fit in the charts? 

'Back then if you weren’t in the top ten it was a disaster. But there are so many different styles of music now so I don’t think it matters where you end up in the charts, or if you aren’t in the top ten.

Opening up: 'It's so important for kids to have someone to talk to, and not everybody has the luxury, or is brave enough to talk to those around them,' she said

'We decided to keep to the Steps formula that we know worked for our songs with proper lyrics and a good melody, stick a dance routine on the top and it fit. We made it work in our own little way.' 

Steps brought out their new album Tears On The Dancefloor: Crying At The Disco, featuring their new single Dancing With A Broken Heart, at the end of October 2017.  

Their new music also marks the first time the group have their own say on what they create for fans, Claire said: 'We chose every song that went on the album, and it’s the first time that we have been able to do that. 

'Back in the PWL days we were just told to sing something, and that was what went on, we were never asked for our opinion. So it’s quite exciting that we’ve had a say on what’s on the album rather than just be told.' 

Claire Richards is the face of the Spectacle Wearer of the Year Awards 2018, Specsavers’ nationwide search for proud glasses wearers aged 16 and over from across the UK. The competition is now open. For each entry, Specsavers will donate £1 to the anti-bullying charity Kidscape.

But Claire Richards, 40, has revealed that she would never sell her award like former pop star Paul Cattermole, 40, did earlier this year - trading it for £66,100 on online auctioning site eBay. Talking about the prestigious prize, she told MailOnline: 'Mine is in my office in a bell jar so it’s protected, all polished and lovely so I will never be selling mine.'

item.title: Busty Lilly Becker puts on an eye-popping display as she slips into daring bandeau bikini during idyllic Miami trip
item.description: The 41-year-old Dutch model highlighted her enviable pins in the daring bandeau two-piece alongside her eight-year-old son Amadeus on Miami beach.
item.content:encoded:
She has been showcasing her sensational figure while holidaying in Miami.

And Lilly Becker continued to flaunt her incredible curves as she soaked up the Florida sun on Monday in a head-turning crochet two-piece.

The 41-year-old Dutch model highlighted her enviable pins and taut stomach in the daring bandeau two-piece alongside her eight-year-old son Amadeus on Miami beach. 

Bikini babe: Lilly Becker continued to flaunt her incredible curves as she soaked up the Florida sun on Monday in a head-turning crochet two-piece

The European beauty commanded attention along the shore in her strapless bikini top which accentuated her ample cleavage as she exited the sea following her cooling dip.

She exhibited her pert posterior in her swimwear while she walked along the sand, looking utterly relaxed. 

Make-up free Lilly donned a pair of oversized circular shades while she covered her waist-length braids with a backwards baseball cap.

Ever thew doting mother, she later playfully built sand castles with her little boy Amadeus, before they both went for a swim in the crystal clear sea.

Work it: The 41-year-old Dutch model highlighted her enviable pins and taut stomach in the daring bandeau two-piece

Seas the day: She exhibited her pert posterior in her swimwear while she walked along the sand, looking utterly relaxed

Her outing comes nine months after her husband Boris' financial woes hit the headlines in June when it was reported that he never paid back an undisclosed debt to a private bank.

In October, the 50-year-old insisted that his bankruptcy was a 'misunderstanding', explaining that he is 'in a position' to settle the bill.

Speaking to The Times, the former Tennis pro claimed that the situation arose because of a dispute over the interest he owes.

He said: 'I am in a position to settle to an amount that I owe. It's a bit like if you go to a restaurant and order a chicken sandwich and a cola and the bill is £10,000.

Fresh-faced: Lilly opted to go make-up free for the sun-soaked outing

Waist not: Lilly highlighted her narrow midriff and gym-honed figure

'I'd like to go over the bill with the restaurant owner and that chance hasn't been given to me. That's why I call this a big misunderstanding. I'm not running away. I live in the middle of London. I'm not hiding.'

There is a possibility Boris' bankruptcy could be annulled should he settle his dispute in the coming months.

In light of his woes, the German star has set his sights on reaching a resolution, which he deemed as 'important' to him.

He said: 'I would like to have an annulment. It's important to me. I could sit it out and say, "My doctor is telling me I need a holiday; my wife hasn't seen me much." Theoretically I could do that, but that is the last thing I want to do. To clarify, I want to settle the bill and move on with my life.'

No shade: Lilly donned a pair of oversized circular shades for the day

Plait's nice: She covered her waist-length braids with a backwards baseball cap

Shore thing: Her outing comes nine months after her husband Boris' financial woes hit the headlines in June when it was reported that he never paid back an undisclosed debt to a private bank

And the former Wimbledon champion explained that he takes 'full responsibility' for his financial situation but had the bank played theoretical tennis 'doubles' with him, he would have avoided his bankruptcy.

His frank interview comes after the sportsman reportedly earned in the region of £100million throughout his career, but was declared bankrupt in June over a £3.3million debt.

Speaking in an interview with Swiss newspaper, Neue Zürcher Zeitung, Mr Becker said: 'It's crazy to think I'm broke'.

'I have enough national and international deals to earn an income that will allow me to pay my staff on time and carry on my life as normal. It's true that I have been in bankruptcy since June 21, but it's wrong that I am broke.' 

Water about that: In October, the 50-year-old insisted that his bankruptcy was a 'misunderstanding', explaining that he is 'in a position' to settle the bill

Ray of light: Speaking to The Times, the former Tennis pro claimed that the situation arose because of a dispute over the interest he owes

Boris married his first wife Barbara in December 1993, with the couple going on to have Noah and Elias. 

However in the summer of 1999, while Barbara was seven months pregnant with Elias, Boris fathered his daughter Anna during a one-night-stand with Russian model Angela Ermakova at Nobu in London.

When Barbara found out about the one night stand she moved to Florida and filed for divorce.

Splish splash: Ever thew doting mother, she later playfully built sand castles with her little boy Amadeus, before they both went for a swim in the crystal clear sea

Bonding: Lilly's little boy donned a pair of red swimshorts which matched his goggles

She fought their pre-nuptial agreement and managed to win more than £14million and the custody of both sons in a divorce court.

Although Boris disputed paternity, a DNA test in February 2001 proved that he was the father and he agreed to support Anna, now a budding model, and obtained joint custody in November 2007.

After moving to Switzerland and enjoying a few years out of in the media spotlight, Becker remarried in 12 June 2009 in St Moritz, Switzerland to the Dutch model. 

Family time: She looked delighted as they spent time together
item.dc:abstract: She has been showcasing her sensational figure while holidaying in Miami. And Lilly Becker continued to flaunt her incredible curves as she soaked up the Florida sun on Monday in a head-turning crochet two-piece.
item.dc:creator: Lisa Mcloughlin

item.title: Can we REALLY be viewing a Ewing? Former Dallas star Patrick Duffy still has a twinkle in his eye despite his thick black hair being replaced by a slicked back grey pony tail
item.description: The American actor, who's known for playing Bobby Erwing in the CBS drama Dallas, appeared on a German TV show alongside David Hasselhoff this weekend.
item.content:encoded:
With his thick black hair and tanned skin, he was the heartthrob of the Eighties.

But Patrick Duffy, now 69, looked significantly different to his pin-up days this weekend.

The American actor, who's known for playing Bobby Ewing in the CBS drama Dallas, appeared on a German TV show alongside David Hasselhoff this weekend.

Patrick Duffy's once thick black hair has has been replaced by a slicked back grey pony tail. Pictured left, as Bobby Ewing in Dallas and right, this weekend

His once thick black hair has been replaced by a slicked back grey pony tail, while his skin appeared wrinkled.

The father of two played the youngest son of Miss Ellie and the nicest brother of J.R. Ewing in Dallas, which followed the life of a wealthy and feuding Texas family, the Ewings, between 1978 and 1985.

Despite its success worldwide, Duffy, a practicing Buddhist, decided to leave the series in 1985, with his character being killed off on screen.

But his character proved so crucial to the ratings, that he reprised his role a year later.

The American actor appeared on a German TV show alongside David Hasselhoff (pictured with Duffy) this weekend

Duffy then remained with the series - directing several episodes - until its cancellation in 1991.

Duffy, who is also a singer, said last month he was unemployed for years when starting out as an actor.

He said: 'From high school on I wanted to act, that was all I wanted to do. I wasn't employed for years but I have been very fortunate and successful.' 

Duffy has been married to wife Carlyn Rosser, a professional ballet dancer 10 years his senior, for 41 years.

They have two grown up sons and four grandchildren.
item.dc:abstract: With his thick black hair and tanned skin, he was the heartthrob of the Eighties. But Patrick Duffy, now 69, looked significantly different to his pin-up days this weekend. The American actor, who's known for playing Bobby Erwing in the CBS drama Dallas, appeared on a German TV show alongside David Hasselhoff this weekend. His once thick black hair has been replaced by a slicked back grey pony tail, while his skin appeared wrinkled.

item.title: Pregnant Eva Longoria puts her baby bump on display in a classic black T-shirt and leggings as she enjoys a brunch date in Miami
item.description: The actress, 43, showed off her beautiful bump as she indulged her pregnancy cravings with a hearty brunch at Yardbird Southern Table in Miami, Florida, on Sunday.
item.content:encoded:
She's expecting her first child with husband José 'Pepe' Bastón in May. 

And Eva Longoria showed off her beautiful bump as she indulged her pregnancy cravings with a hearty brunch at Yardbird Southern Table in Miami, Florida, on Sunday.

The actress, 43, opted for a comfortable ensemble for her low-key day out, choosing a classic black T-shirt which hugged her blossoming shape.   

Bumping along: Eva Longoria showed off her beautiful bump as she indulged her pregnancy cravings with a hearty brunch at Yardbird Southern Table in Miami, Florida, on Sunday

The former Desperate Housewives star paired her simple tee with black cropped leggings and matching sneakers.

The brunette lightened her ensemble with a chic grey cross-body bag with a coordinated baseball cap that tucked back her glossy chestnut tresses.

Eva shielded her eyes from the bright Florida sunshine in a pair of reflective aviator shades.

Off-duty beauty: The actress, 43, opted for a comfortable ensemble for her low-key day out, choosing a classic black T-shirt which hugged her blossoming shape

The Telenovela showcased her natural pregnancy glow without any hint of make-up, but did include some sparkle with diamond earrings.

With her first baby on the way in a matter of weeks, Eva doesn't appear to be slowing down any time soon as she attended the filming of her new ABC soap Grand Hotel in Miami last week. 

While the multi-talented actress is busy with her thriving career, Eva recently spilled to Entertainment Tonight she was so busy she sometimes forgot she was pregnant.

'I have been working, so sometimes I wake up and I forget I am pregnant. Like this morning, I was like, "Oh my god, I am late!" and then I was like, "Why can't I get out of bed?" and I was like, "Helppp!" 

Busy mum-to-be: While the multi-talented actress is busy with her thriving career, Eva recently said she is so busy she sometimes forgets she is pregnant

'And then I was like, "Oh yeah, this thing." ... [I said] we should go skiing next weekend and [Jose] said no. I didn't know why. 

'I was like, "Why can't we go? What is the problem?" And I was like, "Oh god, I forgot!"'

Eva and her media mogul husband confirmed her pregnancy in January after rumours began circling at the end of last year, when she posted a photo of her growing baby bump on her Instagram account.

The couple tied the knot in Mexico in May 2016. 

Expecting! Eva confirmed her pregnancy in January after rumours began circling at the end of last year, when she posted a photo of her growing baby bump on her Instagram account

item.title: Coronation Street SPOILER: Ryan Connor is back in Weatherfield after fleeing to Ibiza... but is confronted by Michelle's furious fiancé Robert Preston in dramatic scenes
item.description: Ryan Connor - now played by Ryan Prescott - is returning to Coronation Street after a five year absence - and kicked off filming his run as the non-biological son of Kym Marshs' character
item.content:encoded:
He was last spotted fleeing the Cobbles for sunny Ibiza in 2013. 

But now Ryan Connor - now played by newcomer Ryan Prescott - is returning to Coronation Street after a five year absence, and kicked off filming his run as the non-biological son of Kym Marsh's character Michelle on Monday. 

Michelle's fiance Robert Preston - played by Tristan Gemmill - doesn't want Ryan to cause the couple any trouble as they prepare to walk down the aisle, so decided to pay him a visit.

Coronation Street SPOILER: Ryan Connor (Ryan Prescott) finally returned to the Cobbles in dramatic scenes with Michelle's fiance Robert and Daniel filmed on Monday

In dramatic scenes, Robert and Daniel - portrayed by Rob Mallard - rushed to Ryan's known address to confront him. 

Robert was seen storming into the house shouting for Ryan, causing calamity while inside.  

Despite the tense scenes, the cast found time to have a bit of fun, with Rob Mallard cracking a smile and waving to the cameras.

Tense moments ahead: In 2008, when Michelle (played by Kym Marsh) discovered her son Ryan - played then by Ben Thompson - was not biologically hers (Pictured 2012) 

Dramatic scenes: Robert (L) was seen storming into the house shouting for Ryan, causing calamity while inside.

Smiles: When the cameras weren't rolling, the cast managed to crack a smile and have fun

 Disheveled: Daniel appeared out of sorts as he wore a velvet jacket and crooked tie

Confusion: In dramatic scenes, Robert and Daniel - portrayed by Rob Mallard - rushed to Ryan's known address to confront him

While it's unknown what his re-emergence will bring, Ryan certainly has has a storied history in the Weatherfield town.

In 2008, when Michelle discovered her son Ryan - played then by Ben Thompson - was not biologically hers.

In a hospital mix-up, Michelle found out she had been raising the wrong child for 16 years, and was soon reunited with her biological son Alex.

Despite the tense scenes, the cast found time to have a bit of fun, with Tristan Gemmill cracking a smile and waving to the cameras.

After the show: Rob Mallard threw a wave at the cameras as he left the set

Post filming: Rob threw on a leather jacket to make his way home after filming the intense scenes on Monday

After moving in Michelle, the good times weren't to last and soon Alex left Corrie, before his reappearance in February as the Street's new GP.

Meanwhile Ryan - recast as actor Sol Heras - moved to Ibiza to work as a DJ, and has also been rarely heard from since his departure in 2013.

In February, Michelle came face to face with her son after heading to the medical centre with a cut hand.

Sadly Michelle was left heartbroken when Ali refused to talk to her or build bridges in their relationship, so fans will have to wait and see whether the pair will be able to grow closer again. 

Preparing: Rob appeared calm before filming the dramatic moments

Clocking out: Tim carried his belongings off the set after his furious meeting with Ryan

Intensified: Rob appeared anxious as the scenes of their first meeting continued

But now Ryan Connor - now played by newcomer Ryan Prescott - is returning to Coronation Street after a five year absence, and kicked off filming his run as the non-biological son of Kym Marsh's character Michelle on Monday. Michelle's fiance Robert Preston - played by Tristan Gemmill - doesn't want Ryan to cause the couple any trouble as they prepare to walk down the aisle, so decided to pay him a visit.

item.title: 'We've normalised that reality': Carrie Grant speaks about daughter Talia's battle with autism as she discusses raising a family with complex behavioural issues in candid interview
item.description: In February she spoke about the struggles of raising a family with complex behavioural needs including Attention Deficit Hyperactivity Disorder and Autism.
item.content:encoded:
In February she spoke about the struggles of raising a family with complex behavioural issues including Attention Deficit Hyperactivity Disorder and Autism.

And Carrie Grant has opened up about her daughter Talia's battle with autism as well as her family life in a candid interview on Monday's episode of Lorraine, in aid of the National Autistic Society’s World Autism Awareness Week 

The 52-year-old vocal coach appeared with her 16-year-old daughter, who has Aspergers (a form of autism) and dyscalculia, a learning disability which affects people using number related concepts, such as arithmetic. 

Scroll down for video 

Candid: Carrie Grant has opened up about her daughter Talia's (both above) battle with autism as well as her family life in a candid interview on Monday's episode of Lorraine, in aid of the National Autistic Society’s World Autism Awareness Week

Carrie and husband David, 61, have four children in all, with each suffering from various behavioral disorders, -actress Olivia, 23, suffers from ADHD and dyspraxia, the couple's 12-year-old daughter Imogen is also autistic and has ADHD, 

Their youngest son Nathan - adopted from the age of two - has ADHD and attachment issues. 

Determined to raise awareness of the condition Carrie said: 'There are huge advantages and challenges, that’s our reality, we’ve normalised that reality, Talia is really creative and we are so proud of her.'  

'When you are first told your child is autistic, people ask does your child speak, all these other questions. 

Interview: The 52-year-old vocal coach appeared with her 16-year-old daughter, who has Aspergers (a form of autism) and dyscalculia, a learning disability which affects people using number related concepts, such as arithmetic

'For someone like Talia, it shows as their anxiety is through the roof, she’d be sitting there looking calm, those unpredictable things, life is unpredictable, like going to school can be stressful.'  

After watching a video showing the daily struggles of a girl with autism Talia said: ‘That’s my everyday experience, watching that I really related to it because it’s what I go through on a daily basis, it can be really stressful to do everyday things like travelling. ' 

'Structure is really important for me, I need to know what my day is going to be like, any change can be disruptive.' 

Family first: Determined to raise awareness of the condition Carrie said: 'There are huge advantages and challenges, that’s our reality, we’ve normalised that reality, Talia is really creative and we are so proud of her'

Inspiration: After watching a video showing the daily struggles of a girl with autism Talia said: ‘That’s my everyday experience, watching that I really related to it because it’s what I go through on a daily basis, it can be really stressful to do everyday things like travelling'

Asked about actor Jules Robertson, who himself is autistic and plays a character with the condition on Holby City, Carrie praised the hospital drama. 

She said: ‘We’re getting different images of autism out there now, we’ve got to learn about it, we have, Talia has. We need more characters like this actually.' 

Talia added; 'Autism is not really represented , people see me and think I don’t have it, she looks like everyone else, there's a lot inside going on, ten times more than everyone else

'We need more autistic girls, I feel they are very underrepresented, a lot of the time people only see autism in boys.'

Praise: Asked about actor Jules Robertson, who himself is autistic and plays a character with the condition on Holby City, Carrie praised the hospital drama saying : ‘We need more characters like this actually'

Support: Carrie also gave advice for supporting people with behavioural conditions, 'If you see someone in the tube and they look anxious, or in the supermarket,don’t avoid them, don’t look away.'

 Carrie also gave advice for supporting people with behavioural conditions.

'When I was younger my mum told me if there is someone with a white cane, you help them across the street. But it can be difficult if you don;t know. If you see someone in the tube and they look anxious, or in the supermarket,don’t avoid them, don’t look away.'

'If your children have extreme special interests, I would be saying there’s some signs there, or if they don't like their food touching.  

Proud: Carrrie smiled  as she posed with her middle daughter at the show 

Carrie and David also revealed their son Nathan was forced to change schools, after being ostracised by his peers' parents due to his unpredictable behaviour.

They went onto say that their home implements the 'all are welcome' policy, following the bustling atmosphere of David's Jamaican upbringing.     

Carrie and David first rose to fame in the early 2000s as judges on Fame Academy and Pop Idol, as well as working as vocal coaches for many years.

David also won an army of fans as a member of the 1980s funk group Linx. 

Fame: Carrie and David first rose to fame in the early 2000s as judges on Fame Academy and Pop Idol, as well as working as vocal coaches for many years
item.dc:abstract: In February she spoke about the struggles of raising a family with complex behavioural needs including Attention Deficit Hyperactivity Disorder and Autism. And Carrie Grant has opened up about her daughter Talia's battle with autism as well as her family life in a candid interview on Monday's episode of Lorraine, in aid of World Autism Awareness Day next week.

item.title: 'So proud!' Tori Spelling's daughter starts her own business... just weeks after the 90210 actress suffered breakdown from 'terrible financial issues'
item.description: Tori Spelling is one proud mama. On Sunday, the 44-year-old actress took to Instagram to share that her eldest daughter Stella McDermott has started her own business of the gooey variety.
item.content:encoded:
Tori Spelling is one proud mama.

On Sunday, the 44-year-old actress took to Instagram to share that her eldest daughter Stella McDermott has started her own business.

In the post, the mother-of-five wrote: 'My @missstellamcdermott has officially started her own #slimebiz. You can go to @stylishslimebystella.'

Proud mama! Tori Spelling took to Instagram on Sunday to share that her eldest daughter Stella has started her own slime business

The Beverly Hills, 90210 star explained that the child, aged nine, already has her eyes set on the future: 'She is starting now to save to open her own bakery after college! So proud of my #tweenpreneur #slimetween.'

The doting mother closed out: 'Follow her to see the slimes she’ll make #forkidsbykids. Link in her bio. And, yes she was #chickenbombed #mamachicken'. 

In the snap, Stella proudly showed off some tubs of her custom green sludge with a chicken posing in the background.

United front: Tori and her husband Dean McDermott have had their ups and downs, but the couple put on a front of togetherness to support their daughter's budding business

And while they have had their ups and downs, Spelling and her husband of 11 years, Dean McDermott, put on a front of togetherness as the father shared a fun video of Stella throwing her creation.

'So proud of my little mama starting her own business,' wrote the 51-year-old actor.

Earlier this month, police were called to the family home in Woodland Hills after Tori reportedly suffered a mental breakdown.

Breakdown: Police were called to the Woodland Hills family home earlier this month after reports that Tori suffered from a mental illness; the actress pictured with her family last week 

According to Entertainment Tonight, 'There are several things that led up to this, and she really couldn't take the pressure any longer,' said a source. 'Tori tries to be the best mom she can be, but with five children and terrible financial issues, her marriage has suffered tremendously.'  

The daughter of famed TV producer Aaron Spelling, Tori's financial woes weren't always the case. 

She was born into one of the richest and most famous Hollywood families and grew up in the largest mansion in Los Angeles - a 56,000 sqft house with 123 rooms dubbed 'The Manor.'

Silver spoon: The Beverly Hills 90210 star grew up in one of the richest families in Hollywood, but her mega producer father Aaron Spelling reportedly only left her $800,000 when he died

However, while the actress' father created mega hits like Charlie's Angels and Dynasty, the public was shocked to find out what his daughter was actually left in his will.  

Tori reportedly inherited just $800,000 out of the roughly $600 million her TV producing legend father Aaron Spelling is said to have left behind when he died.   

And after years of allegedly overspending, the money problems caught up to her. In 2016, ET reported that Tori and her husband owed over $250,000 in unpaid taxes.

The scandal broke soon after the starlet was sued by American Express for having an outstanding limit of nearly $38,000 but failing to  make a payment in over a year.

'Just because I'm on TV doesn't mean that I don't make financial choices that aren't good,' explained the starlet. 'They were really bad ones.' 

Money woes: Years of alleged overspending have caught up to Tori, who is dealing with 'terrible financial issues'

item.title: 'You've got very nice boobs!': Christine McGuinness turns the heads of her co-stars as she makes glam debut on Real Housewives of Cheshire... following marital drama with husband Paddy
item.description: The 30-year-old, who makes her debut on the show on Monday night, was seen meeting co-star Ester for the first time in the clip - and immediately catches her attention with her breasts.
item.content:encoded:
She is thought to have resolved her marital woes with husband Paddy, after he was spotted arm-in-arm with Nicole Appleton during a night out in Soho. 

And Christine McGuinness certainly seemed back to her confident best on Monday, in the trailer for the new series of Real Housewives of Cheshire.

The 30-year-old, who makes her debut on the show this season, was seen meeting co-star Ester Dohnalová for the first time in the clip - and immediately catches her attention with her glamorous appearance.

New girl in town: Christine McGuinness seemed back to her confident best on Monday as the trailer for her first appearance in The Real Housewives of Cheshire was released

'You've got very nice boobs!': The 30-year-old was seen meeting co-star Ester (R) for the first time in the clip - and immediately catches her attention with her glamorous appearance

Christine looks happier than ever in the teaser, as she arrives at a clothing store to greet pal Tanya Bardsley and her friend Ester.

Having been spotted crying at the wheel of her car last month, following her marital woes with Paddy, the blonde was back to her glamorous best on the show - clad in a faux-fur gilet, and carrying a designer handbag on her arm.  

However, Ester's head was immediately turned by Christine's top of choice, which featured a daring caged cut-out across the chest, to tease at her cleavage.

Arrival: Christine looks happier than ever in the teaser, as she arrives at a clothing store to greet pal Tanya Bardsley (R) and her friend Ester

Playful: However, Ester's head was immediately turned by Christine's top, which featured a daring caged cut-out across the chest

As the pair hugged in greeting, Ester, known for her bold and often controversial nature, declared: 'You've got very nice boobs!'

Slightly taken aback, Christine then erupted into giggles and replied: 'You too!', as she playfully clutched her chest. 

While she only makes a fleeting appearance in the trailer, the mother-of-three will no doubt join the Housewives at their typically raucous - and often dramatic - parties throughout the new season.

They're back: While she only makes a fleeting appearance in the trailer, the mother-of-three will no doubt join the Housewives at their typically raucous parties throughout the series

Leading ladies: The seventh series of the reality show, which also features a cast trip to Marrakech, kicks off on Monday night at 10pm, on ITVBe

The seventh series of the reality show, which also features a cast trip to Marrakech, kicks off on Monday night at 10pm, on ITVBe.

The show marks Christine's first foray into reality television, amid rumours she is also set to appear on the new series of I'm A Celebrity, Get Me Out Of Here! 

Sources told the Mirror that ITV execs were keen to get the 30-year-old onboard as they believe what she has to say about her relationship with the Take Me Out Host, 44, would be a ratings goldmine. 

In demand: The show marks Christine's first foray into reality TV, amid rumours she is also set to appear on the new series of I'm A Celebrity in order to spill on her marital woes with Paddy

Last month Christine's marriage to the comedian was rocked when he was spotted on a cosy night out with singer Nicole Appleton, 43, in Soho.

However, Christine's friend and Real Housewives co-star Dawn Ward claimed the pair had resolved their issues at the TRIC Awards in London earlier this month. 

She said: 'She's an amazing person and a great mum. She's been through a lot recently. I know Paddy and Christine really, really well and now she's in a good place.

'She looks amazingly happy so that's all that matters. Her and Paddy are really strong, have a great marriage and beautiful children.'

Trouble: Last month Christine's marriage to the comedian was rocked when he was spotted on a cosy night out with singer Nicole Appleton, 43, in Soho (pictured together in October)

Sources also recently claimed that she and Paddy were happy and living under the same roof once again, after he managed to 'win back her trust'.

An insider told The Sun: 'Things were really not good between the couple up until early last week and friends were left fearing for their marriage. 

'They have had some very heated and emotional arguments over the last couple of weeks and Paddy obviously had a lot of explaining to do to Christine.

'Christine now believes her husband when he says that nothing romantic happened with Nicole and he has managed to win back her trust.' 

Paddy and Christine raise three children together; twins Leo and Penelope, five, and daughter Felicity, 18 months.

item.title: Stephen Belafonte can't keep his hands off gorgeous girlfriend Jessica Rich as she wows in sparkly jumpsuit for dinner date... after defending her beau's 'messy divorce' from Mel B
item.description: She jumped to his defence last week, and on Sunday Stephen Belafonte couldn't have looked happier to be on a date night with his new girlfriend Jessica Rich.
item.content:encoded:
She jumped to his defence last week, and on Sunday Stephen Belafonte couldn't have looked happier to be on a date night with his new girlfriend Jessica Rich.

Mel B's ex husband beamed as he left The Crustacean Restaurant in Beverly Hills hand in hand with gorgeous TV host Jessica.

Stephen could barely keep his hands off his date, laughing as they shared an embrace on their way home. 

The look of love: Mel B's ex husband Stephen Belafonte beamed as he left The Crustacean Restaurant in Beverly Hills hand in hand with his gorgeous girlfriend Jessica Rich on Sunday

Jessica, 31, dressed to impress for her romantic night out, showing off her curves in a skin-tight sparkly catsuit.

She teamed the figure-flashing bronze number with strappy heels and a chic shoulder bag.

Stephen meanwhile kept things casual in black, adding a pop of colour with his quirky purple suede boots. 

Their date came a day after Stephen's ex Mel attended the Kids' Choice Awards in Inglewood, California with her three daughters, including Madison, six, who she shares with Belfonte, and her ex's daughter Giselle, 13.

Stephen and his new girlfriend have been dating for a number of weeks, and Jessica leaped to the defence of her beau's reputation in the wake of his acrimonious divorce battle with the Spice Girl in an interview with The Mirror earlier this month.

I got you babe! Stephen could barely keep his hands off his date, who works as a designer and TV host, laughing as they shared an embrace on their way home

The fashion designer/TV host offered her take on the situation, telling the publication: 'Whenever you go through a messy divorce a lot of things are going to be said.'

The couple's headline-grabbing divorce battle lasted seven-months and included lurid tales of kinky sex, drug and alcohol abuse and allegations of domestic violence.

Rich — who appeared on VH1's 2008 dating series Real Chance of Love — said she didn't have any ill will towards the Wannabe singer, adding: 'I wish her the best of luck. I respect her 100% and I hope everything works out.

The duo's divorce was finalised last December, granting Belafonte joint custody of their six-year-old daughter Madison.

Ex: Their date came a day after Stephen's ex Mel attended the Kids' Choice Awards in Inglewood, California with her three daughters, including Madison, six, (centre) who she shares with Belfonte, and her ex's daughter Giselle, 13 (second from right)

Stephen is still at odds with Mel over custody of her daughter Angel, who she had with Eddie Murphy. Belafonte is asking for step-parent visitation.

Jessica also offered some insight into her relationship with the restaurateur/film producer, telling The Mirror that they're taking things slowly.

'He’s only just come out of a marriage and we don’t want to force a title so we are taking things slow,' Rich said. 'I have a good feeling when I’m with him. We have the same mindset.'

The designer said she wasn't worried about public opinions, saying: 'I am getting a lot of bad press dating him but I’m like "as far as I know, he’s an amazing person."'

During the chat Jessica also revealed the she and Stephen first met six years ago while he and Mel were still married, but sparked a relationship upon reconnecting several months ago at his restaurant. 

Messy split: The duo's divorce was finalised last December, granting Belafonte joint custody of their six-year-old daughter Madison

item.title: They're married! Dancing With The Stars pros Emma Slater and Sasha Farber wed in extravagant style
item.description: Dancing With The Stars professionals Emma Slater and Sasha Farber have tied the knot.
item.content:encoded:
Dancing With The Stars professionals Emma Slater and Sasha Farber have tied the knot.

The couple wed at the elegant banquet hall Bella Blanca in Los Angeles on Sunday, March 25. 

And the fan favorites spared no expense when it came to their big day, indulging their fantasies with an opulent ceremony. 

They're married! Dancing With The Stars pros Emma Slater and Sasha Farber have wed in extravagant style; the two are pictured together in November

The bride, 29, wore two Rivini wedding dresses, walking down the aisle in a fitted gown with sheer lace panels.

She then switched this for a sheath with a long-flowing skirt to dance the night away with her 33-year-old new spouse, with their first dance taking place to Ed Sheeran’s Perfect - with the singer recording a personal message for the pair.

The festivities were witnessed by a host of the DWTS family, including Julianne Hough and her husband Brooks Laich, Nick and Vanessa Lachey, Drew Scott, and Cheryl Burke.

Bride and groom: The two celebrated their engagement on live television in 2016

And the famous faces dined on steak, red caviar and smoked salmon, followed by five different flavors of cake, according to Us Weekly.

Guests were also treated to Greenleaf scented candles and Casamigos tequila as favors, while the bridesmaids were gifted fuchsia clutch handbags and the groomsmen leather wallets.

The pair became engaged on live television, back in October 2016, with Sasha getting down on one knee after they performed a couple's dance.

'Babe, I've wanted to do this for such a long time,' he told Emma as the audience screamed in joy. 'I love you so, so much.'

'I love you!' she replied, before telling him yes.

And the fan favorites spared no expense when it came to their big day, indulging their fantasies with an opulent ceremony.

item.title: The colour of love! TOWIE's Gemma Collins steps out in pink and red as she FINALLY makes relationship with James Argent official after seven years
item.description: The reality star, 37, stepped out without her love Arg, 30, during the casual trip but looked happy and relaxed while catching up with friends in Essex.
item.content:encoded:
She finally confessed her love for James 'Arg' Argent on Sunday's episode of The Only Way Is Essex after seven years of on-off dating. 

And Gemma Collins looked cheerful as she caught up with friends in Essex as TOWIE fans rejoiced over the union.

The reality star, 37, stepped out without her love Arg, 30, during the casual trip but looked happy and relaxed in her striking pink and red striped jumper.

Loved up: Gemma Collins, 37, looked worlds away from her usual TOWIE glamour during a casual outing with friends in Essex on Saturday... after confessing her love for James Argent

Opting for an unusually low-key look, the TV personality kept it comfortable in a pair of black joggers and monochrome trainers.

The Celebs Go Dating star wrapped up in a stylish faux-fur gilet, while her blonde locks were swept up into a messy half-up do.

Flanked by her friends, Gemma went without her trademark jewellery and show-stopping make-up, instead going fresh-faced. 

New chapter: Gemma and Arg confirmed their relationship on Sunday night's TOWIE - revealing they had bought a house together in Spain

Off-duty beauty: The reality star, 37, stepped out without her love Arg, 30, during the casual trip but looked happy and relaxed in her striking pink and red striped jumper

Wrapping up: Slipping into her warm jumper, Gemma joined her friends for the chilled out day

The bubbly blonde looked utterly smitten with Arg during their loved-up moment on Sunday's episode of TOWIE.

On the season premiere, Gemma and Arg finally confirmed their relationship - revealing they had bought a house together in Spain and were already thinking of having children.  

The reality stars left TOWIE viewers stunned by the unexpected baby news when they visited a financial adviser and exchanged 'I love you' to each other.

Loved up: Hours after her trip with friends, Gemma finally confirmed her relationship with Arg on the season premiere of TOWIE after seven years of on-off dating 

Sealed with a kiss: Visiting a financial advisor to discuss opening a joint bank account, the pair looked happier than ever as they joked about Gemma having 'more staff than Mariah Carey'

Visiting the financial advisor to discuss opening a joint bank account, the pair looked happier than ever as they joked about Gemma having 'more staff than Mariah Carey'.  

Gemma said: 'We got matching watches and we've bought a holiday home in Spain and now we're setting up a joint bank account.  

'We've known each other for so long, we know other so well...I love you so much, I'll give you anything I've got. Every week we want to put a thousand into the account...  

Simple style: Opting for an unusually low-key look, Gemma kept it comfortable in a pair of black joggers and monochrome trainers

'What it is, I'm a big roller, I earn well, I spend well. If Arg is watching the football, I'll have a massage girl come round.' 

Arg then interrupted: 'She has more staff than Mariah Carey. She has a cleaner come round five times a week to clean her two bedroom apartment.'  

In the midst of the banter, the Meme Queen then dropped the bombshell that their new property was in part to 'relax her body for a baby' when the adviser asked if they would consider setting up an account for their future offsprings - a question which James nervously laughing.

Smiles: The Celebs Go Dating beauty wrapped up in a stylish faux-fur gilet while her blonde locks were swept up into a messy half-up do

She confessed: 'Part of going to Spain is to relax my body to prepare for a baby.' 

Speaking to OK! hours after they confirmed their coupling , Gemma gushed that Arg was now 'fully committed' to her after weeks of indecision, and revealed the pair have spent every night together since taking their relationship to the next level.  

After enduring weeks of unrequited love, Gemma gushed: 'To hear that he was ready to commit was a dream come true after so many years of not knowing where we both stand.’

Keeping it casual: Flanked by her friends, Gemma went without her trademark jewelry and show-stopping make-up

‘James is like a different man since we made things official. I can tell he’s completely committed to me now.'  

Clearly more besotted than ever, Gemma also admitted the pair are inseparable, and have barely spent time apart since declaring their love.

She added: 'Every morning he puts on a love song for me and before we go to bed he cuddles me and tells me how beautiful I am. I feel so secure with him.

‘We haven’t spent a night apart since we made things official – James has basically moved into my flat.’

Strong: Gemma gushed that Arg was now 'fully committed' to her, and revealed the pair have spent every night together since making it official (pictured in November)

And Gemma Collins looked cheerful as she caught up with friends in Essex as TOWIE fans rejoiced over the union. The reality star, 37, stepped out without her love Arg, 30, during the casual trip but looked happy and relaxed in her striking pink and red striped jumper.

item.title: Made In Chelsea: Mimi can't control herself when Ben asks her to be his girlfriend, and Jamie has moved on from Melody ALREADY
item.description: Habbs is still gunning for that title of biggest meddler in the land. She’s invested in a pearly queen beret and telling Frankie, without blinking, that Digby ‘strongly doesn’t like’ her.
item.content:encoded:
Habbs is still gunning for that title of biggest meddler in the land. She’s invested in a pearly queen beret and telling Frankie, without blinking, that Digby ‘strongly doesn’t like’ her. Liv happens to be power walking around the corner at the exact same moment and seizes the opportunity to inquire about the level of hatred Frankie feels in return toward Digby.

If it were a tornado, the hatred is at about Level 2 on the the Fujita Scale. By the end of the episode it will be F5. That’s over 200mph of seething, windy hate.

Did you know who invented the scissors? Leonardo Da Vinci. Fancy that. Jamie knows this because Francis told him. They’re talking about the absolute disaster that was Melody. Francis is casually pointing out that Jamie told her she was hot and that he loved her, but is interrupted by a phone call which appears to be a French woman.

Frank: Habbs is still gunning for that title of biggest meddler in the land

‘Bonjour! Salut!’ Jamie answers, dredging up that French GCSE he got at Mr Buckleberry’s School For Impressionable Young Men. Turns out the French woman on the phone is called Elle [as in Mademois] and that she is Jamie’s latest foreign squeeze. We don’t know where she’s materialised from [and don’t expect to find that out this episode] but it seems she possesses the ability to use a telephone so that’s good.

‘You didn’t waste any time!’ Francis’ voice suddenly booms, in possibly the worst bit of dubbing ever to happen on Made In Chelsea.

Meanwhile, poor dejected Melody, who has relocated her whole life to come and live in London for Jamie, is getting her hair done, desperately insisting to Clementine that Jamie referred to her as his ‘South African wife’ once. Also, her accent seems to have transmuted into American now.

Liv’s fuming with Frankie and Habbs and calls them ‘trollops’. She goes to Battersea Power Station [which apparently has a restaurant in it?] to meet Louise, Mytton and Digby. Digby comforts her by telling her Frankie must be jealous of them, as if Liv were a nine-year-old girl who has just been smacked on the bare arm by one of her classmates at ballet lessons.

Tensions: If it were a tornado, the hatred is at about Level 2 on the the Fujita Scale. By the end of the episode it will be F5. That’s over 200mph of seething, windy hate

Moving on? Jamie knows this because Francis told him. They’re talking about the absolute disaster that was Melody

He then leaves ‘for a meeting’ [perhaps to feature in another task on The Apprentice] and Liv tells the other two that she’s starting to get slightly annoyed when Digby does stuff like put a wet teaspoon in the sugar bowl.

Mytton wonders whether this could be the first 'crack' starting to appear in their otherwise rather nice romance. ‘This is not a crack Mytton, he saw that long ago,’ Liv corrects him, declaring to the world that she’s not adverse to experimentation in the boudoir. She then mutters something about the honeymoon phase being over and asks Mytton and Louise to keep the conversation to themselves.

So Mytton goes and tells Habbs, naturally.

Beret nice: Habbs invested in a pearly queen beret and telling Frankie, without blinking, that Digby ‘strongly doesn’t like’ her

Making his point: Francis is casually pointing out that Jamie told her she was hot and that he loved her, but is interrupted by a phone call which appears to be a French woman

New squeeze: ‘Bonjour! Salut!’ Jamie answers, dredging up that French GCSE he got at Mr Buckleberry’s School For Impressionable Young Men. Turns out the French woman on the phone is called Elle [as in Mademois] and that she is Jamie’s latest foreign squeeze

Mimi has brought James and Sam Prince to a negligee store so she can parade around in a busty camisole in front of them. When they dare to look at her, she scolds them. ‘I almost have a boyfriend you can’t be doing this!’ she cries, reminding them that Ben very nearly asked her to be his girlfriend last week.

She then announces she’s having a party where everyone has to dress in revealing nightwear and ALL the men can look at her chest.

Habbs tells Frankie that all is ‘not so rosy poesy and butterflies’ in Liv and Digby’s romance. Frankie then ends up at the bar with Digby who informs her that he ‘doesn’t know her well enough to hate her’. Fujita Level 3.

Frankie then plays her trump card [that Liv has got ‘the ick’] to which he replies: ‘In the folder of s**t that you f**king think of where did you f**king find that?’ Fujita Level 5.

Oh no: Meanwhile, poor dejected Melody, who has relocated her whole life to come and live in London for Jamie, is getting her hair done, desperately insisting to Clementine that Jamie referred to her as his ‘South African wife’ once

Fuming: Liv’s fuming with Frankie and Habbs and calls them ‘trollops’. She goes to Battersea Power Station [which apparently has a restaurant in it?] to meet Louise, Mytton and Digby

Friends: Digby comforts her by telling her Frankie must be jealous of them, as if Liv were a nine-year-old girl who has just been smacked on the bare arm by one of her classmates at ballet lessons

Jamie announces that he’s ‘never felt like this before’ about this new girl Elle. Then he explains that, actually, yes he has, when he was 16. Sorry Elle.

Digby didn’t come home last night, or left early without writing Liv a cute message on the kitchen chalk board, or something to this avail. So Liv is devastated. It’s okay though because she finds him and tells him she didn’t once say she had ‘the ick’ [which is true]. She cries proper tears and her voice warbles. So all is forgiven.

Toff left her phone case at James’ house, because they had a night together, but nothing happened [other than her leaving her phone case there].

The phone case is the kind that has a hole in it for the power cable, so she can't have taken the case off so she could charge it and then forgot it. Is Toff trying to entrap James? Well, it worked, because now he can’t get her out of his mind. ‘I’ve started to like you a little bit,’ he says, lukewarmly.

Heating up: Mimi has brought James and Sam Prince to a negligee store so she can parade around in a busty camisole in front of them

Flesh-flashing: When they dare to look at her, she scolds them. ‘I almost have a boyfriend you can’t be doing this!’ she cries, reminding them that Ben very nearly asked her to be his girlfriend last week 

Liv nips round to Frankie’s to tell her ‘I’m going to choose Digby over you’. Then she leaves. A text saying that would have sufficed. 

So Mimi’s party is one of the weirdest in MIC’s history. First of all, it’s unclear where it’s being held. Is this Mimi’s home? The variety of strategically-positioned furniture suggest it’s actually at a chain of Benson’s For Beds.

Secondly, the only real reason there seems to be for dubbing it a ‘pajama party’ is that they get to hit each other with pillows that haven’t been sewn properly, so that the feathers go everywhere. Are they hypo-allergenic, one wonders?

Oh, there’s a bathroom being used as somewhere to sit and drink in, so it can’t be Benson’s For Beds. Dare they have hired out a Homebase? There are oddly-placed people standing around said bathroom by the sinks and the towel rails, while James and Toff sit in the free-standing bath in the centre of the room flirting. James sort of asks Toff to dinner, and she sort of accepts.

Not impressed: Habbs tells Frankie that all is ‘not so rosy poesy and butterflies’ in Liv and Digby’s romance. Frankie then ends up at the bar with Digby who informs her that he ‘doesn’t know her well enough to hate her’. Fujita Level 3 

Not holding back: Frankie then plays her trump card [that Liv has got ‘the ick’] to which he replies: ‘In the folder of s**t that you f**king think of where did you f**king find that?’ Fujita Level 5

How it is: Liv nips round to Frankie’s to tell her ‘I’m going to choose Digby over you’. Then she leaves. A text saying that would have sufficed

Hanging on the telephone: Toff left her phone case at James’ house, because they had a night together, but nothing happened [other than her leaving her phone case there]

Mimi is not with any of her guests. Instead she’s sat in Showroom B on a bed, desperately waiting for Ben to come in and finish the conversation he started a week ago. Have these two not been alone together since Harry barged in on their chat, or have they just not been alone together with a multi-angled camera crew present?

Cringe klaxon! He asks her to be official and Mimi cries ‘You’re my first boyfriend!’ She has been bursting to use that line, you can tell. Probably since the first time she watched Beauty And The Beast and realised men are all perfect. Also, ‘first’ doesn’t bode well for the start of this blossoming romance, does it Mimi? When she gets another one will she christen him her 'second boyfriend'?

Frankie hints that she wants to leave the show for a while and Habbs is worried about who she’s going to do her scenes with. On the stairs, Jamie is loitering in his cotton nightwear. Frankie and he share a cute moment before she walks off, just as a leggy brunette, not dissimilar to Melody, appears. This is Elle – and there will be a prize for whoever can guess what accent she’s putting on, because her diction is terrible.

Moment: Frankie hints that she wants to leave the show for a while and Habbs is worried about who she’s going to do her scenes with

Appearance: Frankie and he share a cute moment before she walks off, just as a leggy brunette, not dissimilar to Melody, appears

Sealed with a kiss: This is Elle – and there will be a prize for whoever can guess what accent she’s putting on, because her diction is terrible
item.dc:abstract: Liv happens to be power walking around the corner at the exact same moment and seizes the opportunity to enquire about the level of hatred Frankie feels in return toward Digby. If it were a tornado, the hatred is at about Level 2 on the the Fujita Scale. By the end of the episode it will be F5. That’s over 200mph of seething, windy hate.
item.dc:creator: Lisa Mcloughlin
item.mi:shortTitle: Made In Chelsea: Jamie has moved on from Melody ALREADY

item.title: 'Hope this makes you smile!': Ben Fogle strips completely nude on Instagram as he goes skinny dipping in the Arctic
item.description: The 44-year-old was seen stripping completely naked and launching himself into the icy water in a string of cheeky snaps on Instagram, as he kick started his morning in Norway.
item.content:encoded:
He is known for his love of the great outdoors, having hosted Countryfile for several years and participating in a number of gruelling treks for charity.

And Ben Fogle certainly proved to be at one with nature on Monday, as he enjoyed a spot of skinny dipping in the Arctic.

The 44-year-old stripped completely naked and launched himself into the icy water in a string of cheeky snaps on Instagram, as he kick-started his morning in Norway.

Taking the plunge: Ben Fogle certainly proved to be at one with nature on Monday, as he enjoyed a spot of skinny dipping in the Arctic

In the snaps, Ben is seen preparing to launch into the water, completely naked - giving a glimpse of his tan lines and derriere to all.

First looking out at the stunning view, with the sun rising behind the snowy rocks before him, the presenter then playfully leaps into the freezing cold sea, with his arms and legs outstretched with excitement.

Documenting his adventurous morning for fans, he captioned the shots: 'Monday morning skinny dip in the arctic' and 'Hope this makes you smile. Cold is weakness leaving the body. #mondaymotivation.'  

Here we go: The 44-year-old was seen stripping completely naked and launching himself into the icy water in a string of cheeky snaps on Instagram, as he kick-started his day in Norway

Ben is known for his love of outdoors, and has fronted television shows such Castaway 2000, Countryfile and Extreme Dreams.

However the presenter is also known to be an adventurer himself - having participated in the Atlantic Rowing Race and trekked across the Empty Quarter of Oman, the largest sand desert in the world, with James Cracknell.

Ben is currently preparing to scale Mount Everest in just four weeks with Olympic cyclist Victoria Pendleton in May, to raise money for the British Red Cross.

Main man: Ben is known for his love of outdoors, and has fronted television shows such Castaway 2000, Countryfile and Extreme Dreams

Challenge: Ben is also known to be an adventurer himself - having participated in the Atlantic Rowing Race and trekked across the Empty Quarter of Oman with James Cracknell (above)

Discussing the daunting project on Instagram last week, he said: 'his will be the biggest, toughest challenge of my life but it has been a childhood dream to try and climb to the summit of the world’s highest mountain. 

'We have spent the last two years training for this attempt and I hope we can inspire others to pursue their own dreams and goals. 

'Our message to you all is that with diligent planning and preparation and with focus, drive and determination, Anything is Possible.' 

'There is so much anger and negativity in the world. I hope our journey can bring some light, inspiration and happiness to those that follow us.'

Next up: Ben is currently preparing to scale Mount Everest in just four weeks with Olympic cyclist Victoria Pendleton in May, to raise money for the British Red Cross
item.dc:abstract: He is known for his love of the great outdoors, having hosted Countryfile for several years and participating in a number of gruelling treks for charity. And Ben Fogle certainly proved to be at one with nature on Monday, as he enjoyed a spot of skinny dipping in the Arctic. The 44-year-old was seen stripping completely naked and launching himself into the icy water in a string of cheeky snaps on Instagram, as he kick started his morning in Norway.

item.title: The tears flowed and the insults flew when Olivia Bentley and Frankie Gaff went to war over Liv having ‘the ick.’ That didn’t stop them partying in their lingerie on Made In Chelsea, by Jim Shelley
item.description: Even avid fans of Made In Chelsea could tell it (and they) had sunk to a new low when it emerged the character this week’s heated, hateful, dramas revolved around was… Digby.
item.content:encoded:
Even avid fans of Made In Chelsea could tell it (and they) had sunk to a new low when it emerged the character this week’s heated, hateful, dramas revolved around was… Digby.

No not Lucy Watson’s pooch sadly. Which of us wouldn’t want to see that? (Her little Pomeranian that is.)

Digby the human though was a recent addition to the cast and previously only a bit-part player, and so dull he must have had viewers wracking their brains to remember who he was. Not his full name (anyone who knew he was called Digby Edgley should take a good hard look at themselves) but what he actually did on the show.

Centre of attention: Even avid fans of Made In Chelsea could tell it (and they) had sunk to a new low when it emerged the character this week’s heated, hateful, dramas revolved around was… Digby

Most of Digby’s relationship with Olivia Bentley had taken place off camera or in between series so it was asking a lot for us to care that their relationship was in jeopardy. Since they’d been living together, Liv said, she had ‘the ick’ - not an STD but modern slang for ‘second thoughts.’

‘The thought of hurting you makes me feel so s**t,’ Olivia sobbed uncharacteristically. ‘I’ve never felt like I do about you and it scares me.’

Digby’s response to such an emotional appeal summed him up.

‘Um, I don’t know, yeah…’

Nonplussed: Most of Digby’s relationship with Olivia Bentley had taken place off camera or in between series so it was asking a lot for us to care that their relationship was in jeopardy

Digby’s passion became altogether more aroused when the conversation turned to Frankie Gaff.

‘I came across those two trollops, Frankie and Habbs, on my way here,’ Liv mentioned, diplomatically.

‘I f**king hate Frankie!’ Digby spat back, even less so.

‘Digby hates you!’ Habbs helpfully confirmed to her friend later.

Unsure: Since they’d been living together, Liv said, she had ‘the ick’ - not an STD but modern slang for ‘second thoughts’

‘Digby can eat s**t!’ hissed Frankie, later describing him to his face as ‘a closet w**ker’ who ‘pretends to be this super-nice, friendly, guy when actually you’re really nasty about people when no one’s watching.’

Not something that anyone could say about her certainly.

There was Something About Frankie that made Digby not just more interesting but turned him into a lunatic.

Upset:  ‘The thought of hurting you makes me feel so s**t,’ Olivia sobbed uncharacteristically. ‘I’ve never felt like I do about you and it scares me' 

Awkward: Digby’s response to such an emotional appeal summed him up. ‘Um, I don’t know, yeah…’

‘That’s just absolute b******s!’ he raged about Frankie’s claim Olivia had ‘the ick.’

‘In the folder of s**t that you f***ing think of, where the f**k do you find that?’

The answer to this was obvious: in the script.

‘Apparently Habbs told you that I F**KING hate you!’ he blazed. ‘I don’t know you well enough to HATE you !’ he insisted (sounding as if he did). ‘I can tell you I certainly have better things to talk about than YOU !’ (sounding as if he didn’t).

His explanation to Olivia for Frankie’s antipathy towards him for example was the classic Male Chauvinist Twit’s: ‘she probably fancies me I reckon.’

Not happy: Frankie Gaff later describing him to his face as ‘a closet w**ker’ who ‘pretends to be this super-nice, friendly, guy when actually you’re really nasty about people when no one’s watching' 

I sleep better at night knowing that she f**king hates me!’ he rambled dementedly. ‘I don’t give a s**t!’

Olivia was caught between her boyfriend and her friend and wanted them all to be friends.

‘Telling my boyfriend I have the ick about our relationship…How the f**k do you think that makes me feel?!’ she screamed to Frankie, in tears. ‘It’s like you just don’t care!’

‘No I don’t!’ Frankie pouted. ‘I DON’T CARE!’

Going wild: There was Something About Frankie that made Digby not just more interesting but turned him into a lunatic

‘I’m going to have to choose Digby over you,’ Liv pointed out reluctantly.

‘That’s honestly fine. If it was me I would as well,’ Frankie assured her, unmoved, evidently/impressively caring even less than we did.

It was all magnificently preposterous and pointless but at least Olivia and Digby were really together.

When James plucked up the courage to ask Toff the tiny toff out she didn’t pretend to take them being a couple seriously, even though they had discussed the possibility with their friends ad nausea.

In the middle: Olivia was caught between her boyfriend and her friend and wanted them all to be friends 

‘We can go out for dinner,’ Toff conceded, before immediately stressing ‘but at the moment I can’t commit myself to anyone.’

Hey, it was only a free dinner in Sloane Street not a Victoria costume drama.

Toff was far more enthusiastic about the ‘major decision’ she had made (‘after a long time thinking about it’) - namely: ‘I’m only content when I’m wearing really big pants!’

‘No!’ objected James, understandably.

Elsewhere Jamie Laing unveiled his second big love in only three episodes when he revealed to Francis Boule: ‘I’m seeing this chick’ (Elle). I want to keep her a bit private, a bit secret, cos I don’t want everybody to know about it.’

Meanwhile: When James plucked up the courage to ask Toff the tiny toff out she didn’t pretend to take them being a couple seriously, even though they had discussed the possibility with their friends ad nausea

Will you tell him or shall I?

‘Honestly I’ve never felt like this before, ever!’ he explained, raving: ‘when I was 16 years old, I went out with a girl and this is the same feeling!'

So not quite ‘never’ then…

‘Have I been a complete a***hole?’ Jamie wondered later to Louise Thompson – a rhetorical question if ever there was one.

‘Wait. Was there an overlap between Elle and Melody?’ she gasped.

‘No there wasn’t an overlap,’ Jamie assured her, which was true if only because he’d never been with Melody in the first place.

Promises: ‘We can go out for dinner,’ Toff conceded, before immediately stressing ‘but at the moment I can’t commit myself to anyone' 

‘You’re the most complicated person!’ Louise sighed – something only a real simpleton could think about Jamie Laing.

Jamie’s response to this comment offered us a clue as to whether she was right.

‘By the way do you ever wear pyjamas?’ he quizzed.

‘I have slutt-air pyjam-airs!’ Louise snorted, trying to sound as posh as the other gals. ‘But only for special occasions.’

It was best not to speculate what this meant.

Excited: Toff was far more enthusiastic about the ‘major decision’ she had made (‘after a long time thinking about it’) - namely: ‘I’m only content when I’m wearing really big pants!' 

Jamie and Louise were, like everyone else in the cast, preparing for Mimi’s party which was not so much an excuse for the girls to reluctantly get their kit off and dress like flappers (with an ‘f’), as virtually an engagement party - in her eyes.

‘I need to look extra hot tonight,’ the Easy Canadian explained standing in La Perla wearing only the expensive bra she was buying in front of the camera to ensure she got the discount. ‘I want Ben to finally ask me. I’ve never felt this way about somebody…in a really long time.’

Again, not quite ‘never’…

Opening up: Elsewhere Jamie Laing unveiled his second big love in only three episodes when he revealed to Francis Boule, ‘I’m seeing this chick’ (Elle). I want to keep her a bit private, a bit secret, cos I don’t want everybody to know about it' 

Sure enough Ben practically went down on one knee.

‘We’ve been seeing each other for a while now and I feel like it’s going really well,’ he began earnestly. ‘So I wanted to ask you…If you want to make it official…And if you wanted to be… my girlfriend?!’

The way Mimi leapt around beaming with excitement, it seemed churlish to point out that they were going out already.

Mimi seemed tragically grateful to be Ben’s ‘girlfriend’, and Olivia Bentley’s protestations about living with Digby giving her ‘the ick’ had evaporated after his furious reaction.

Good times: The cast later turned up for Mimi’s pajama party, with the girls wearing only lacy/racy lingerie and high heels

She joined Frankie, Habbs, and the other young ladies in the cast turning up for Mimi’s party wearing only lacy/racy lingerie and high heels.

Well these were the terms of the dress code for the bash (‘sexy pyjama party’) not to mention their contract (‘do what every E4 says’).

In last year’s series Olivia had photographed some of the girls for a calendar celebrating ‘the strong women’ on Made In Chelsea.

Now she admitted to her boyfriend with a hollow laugh: ‘I look like a slag.’

It summed up her night when Digby failed to contradict her.
item.dc:abstract: Even avid fans of Made In Chelsea could tell it (and they) had sunk to a new low when it emerged the character this week’s heated, hateful, dramas revolved around was… Digby. No not Lucy Watson’s pooch sadly. Which of us wouldn’t want to see that? (Her little Pomeranian that is.) Digby the human though was a recent addition to the cast and previously only a bit-part player, and so dull he must have had viewers wracking their brains to remember who he was. Not his full name (anyone who knew he was called Digby Edgley should take a good hard look at themselves) but what he actually did on the show.

item.mi:shortTitle: The tears flowed on Made In Chelsea, by Jim Shelley
